I worked for 6 hours in total to create 84 pages on this wiki. This is actual time writing: paraphrasing, summarising and material to be used for a specific course - block chain technology practical applications. including basic concepts such as Decentralised consensus and practical examples.

Most time I spent on editing [[Eris]]. [[Trustless transactions]]. Longest time I spent on [[New Legal Language]] page. [[Code is Law]] is an equivalent of a key note, so it required some writing and thinking, more like preparing a presentation or a speech.
<h4>Outcomes<h4>

I worked for 8 hours in total to create 84 pages on this wiki. This is actual time writing: paraphrasing, summarising and material to be used for a specific course - block chain technology practical applications. including basic concepts such as Decentralised consensus and practical examples.

• [[Eris]]
  • [[Rebooting Global Economy]]
  • [[Code is Law]]

Eris part of the wiki aims at summarising relevant content from Eris blog and eventually serving as aplatform to run 6 Eris workshops. Rebooting Global Economy had all the information so far shared on the Rebooting Global Economy project which I can expand after meeting Jordan next week. Code is Law is an experiment to use SFW to structure a presentation. I havent shown slides on the screen, but used it to structure a teaser introduction to blockchain tech for legal hackers meetup in Copenhagen.

<h4>Outcomes<h4> 
Week 2
[[Week 3]]

story.text:
Net time editing 8 hours 84 pages
Research/learning 40 hours 2 weeks period

Eris part of the wiki aims at summarising relevant content from Eris blog and eventually serving as aplatform to run 6 Eris workshops. Rebooting Global Economy had all the information so far shared on the Rebooting Global Economy project which I can expand after meeting Jordan next week. Code is Law is an experiment to use SFW to structure a presentation. I havent shown slides on the screen, but used it to structure a teaser introduction to blockchain tech for legal hackers meetup in Copenhagen.

I worked for 8 hours in total to create 84 pages on this wiki. This is actual time writing: paraphrasing, summarising and material to be used for a specific course - block chain technology practical applications. including basic concepts such as Decentralised consensus and practical examples.

Researching the topic in many cases took more time: reading and watching tutorials, I haven't included in the time tracking. Learning SFW and decisding on how the wiki should be structures is not included in the 6 hours. I haven't counted forking others pages, unless I did editing.
Some pages are stubs, and there is a lot of copypaste referenced material.
So realistically in 6 hours I can create about 100 2 paragraph pages of original and re-mixed, summarised content.

Most time I spent on editing [[Eris]]. [[Trustless transactions]]. Longest time I spent on [[New Legal Language]] page. [[Code is Law]] is an equivalent of a key note, so it required some writing and thinking, more like preparing a presentation or a speech.
I worked on this wiki over the period of 2 weeks, and still learning.
